[b][color=white]MyCode for Instagram[/color][/b]
A new MyCode tag has been introduced for Instagram shortly after the launch of [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]'s official Instagram account: [url=http://instagram.com/hackforums]@hackforums[/url]. Wrap the URL of an Instagram post in ‘ig’ tags to embed it into a post on the forum. There were plans to embed from Twitter, but this is not likely to happen due to complications with fetching tweets. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5232199]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Trust Scan Improvements[/color][/b]
Hack Forums’ Trust Scan feature has just undergone its third revision. Several entries have received color coding (red, amber and green) and records have been cut to consider only the last thirty days - one third from before. The account’s age has also been added which is shown in days. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5241907]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]


[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

No announcement threads were made this week. Check back next week. Meep.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5233361][b]Pickup Directory: Never feeling awkward again[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=#EFEFEF][b]King Cin[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color] I have created a thread that teaches you how to eliminate awkward situations from your life. Check it out if you want to improve yourself socially!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5212406][b]HFAlert | A userscript that alerts you about scammers![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2969158][color=#EFEFEF][b]Silicon Valley[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color] The user Silicon Valley has created an userscript that helps you find users with known scam reports. This is useful if you're an active member of our marketplace. Be sure to give it a look.

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5240815][b]The Road to Self-Actualization[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1742746][color=#EFEFEF][b]typhoid[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The high quality member and professional meme maker, typhoid, has created a thread where he enlightens us about self-actualization. Thank you, typhoid.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5239786][b]Hackforums MAKE UP THREAD (Reconcile with your former enemies)[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67412][color=#00AAFF][b]Vigor[/b][/color][/url] The user Vigor has created a thread where you can make up with users you're currently encountering issues with. I was truly moved by his confession about making up with the member $uicide.

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5213186][b]$100 Text Decryption Contest[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1498262][color=#00AAFF][b]White Noise[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The member White Noise is hosting a rather unique contest. If you can decrypt a certain text that he has posted on his thread, you will win $100. Give it a try!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5211167][b]$100 BTC Giveaway![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2661318][color=#99FF00][b]Vintar[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The user Vintar is giving away $100 in BTC. If you want free money it would be a good idea to check out his thread and enter his contest!

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

No notable feedback threads were made this week. Check back next week if you're so eager to see them, or create your own one.

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4969645][b]How I became TheMostDopePizza[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2693790][color=#00AAFF][b]dopepizza[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The member dopepizza has created a thread where he goes on about something I don't understand. If you like reading random threads and possibly wasting your time, be sure to check this thread out!

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/280/Interview.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866]Enterpriser[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Hey Enterpriser! Welcome to the 288th edition of the HF News. Any shoutouts you want to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] Shoutout to all the Writers.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] You've been on HF for quite a long time now. What has kept  you to stay after all these years?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I have learned a lot these past years through HF. Without HF, I wouldn't know what I know today. I've also made a lot of friends through HF, and we continue to be friends to this very day.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] That's good to hear! What have you learned from HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] I learned that some people are not who they say they are. For example, I've witnessed many scams occur in the HF Marketplace. It's a shame to see innocent members of our community get scammed by these selfish and greedy scammers. I've also learned how to do various things here by reading tutorials and guides made by our very own members. You'll be surprise how much valuable information is on HF.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] I definitely agree with you. HF's a great place to learn. What do you think of the current groups, Enterpriser?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] I think the current groups have gone downhill the past few months. I rarely see any groups contribute to the community (not saying that they are forced to), and I noticed that most groups are just lounge groups. Most of these groups have no purpose unlike previous groups on HF. The Empire, for example, was an outstanding group. They contributed to the community and really put out their name to the community in a good way.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Are you thankful for anything that has occurred on HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] To be quite honest with you, I'm thankful for a lot. Omni's been doing a great job making sure there's a decreasing amount of scammers in the marketplace. He's also has done a lot to prevent members from getting scammed by giving us tools like the Trust Scan. Another thing I'm thankful for is the knowledge that I've acquired over the years here. Without HF, I don't know where I would be today.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Do you ever plan on leaving HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] Unfortunately, yes. There's going to be a time and place when I'll leave HF to pursue other things. HF's a great distraction for me at times, yet it is also a wonderful place to be at.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Do you have any goals or things you want to achieve in life?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] Yes, I do. I plan on graduating from high school and pursuing a life in business management. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] That's an interesting career path. I wish you the best with all your endeavors. Would you like to say anything else before we wrap this up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=white][b]Enterpriser:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you Sinister for interviewing me. It was a pleasure talking to you.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[size=1][color=transparent]       [/color][/size]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 288

posts.message:
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]
[align=center][size=large][b][color=white]Support HF News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#50c072]Gaming News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#6b80ff]Tech News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#fd890d]Hacking News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#7fcdaf]World News[/color][/b][/size][/align]
[color=transparent]       [/color][/font][/size]

[align=center]We publish the HF News every week yet we have aged members who don't even know we exist! Wear any of the signatures listed below to support us and spread the word about HF News, HF Wiki, and Writers altogether. 

[color=white][spoiler=[b]Support Signatures[/b]]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Tg4Iwrl.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2016/04/11/ratchet-and-clank-review][b][color=white]Ratchet and Clank is Back![/color][/b][/url]
Nostalgia permeates the air surrounding the highly anticipated release of Ratchet and Clank. The game hit shelves on April 14 and was met with impressive review scores across the board. Ratchet and Clank is a total re-imagination of the critically acclaimed origin game by the same name that was released in 2002. Insomniac, the development team behind the series, aimed to embody all of Pixar's greatness in the form of a video game. They succeeded the best they ever have in that task with this release of Ratchet and Clank. They took the vibrant worlds, expressive characters, and nuanced humor and turned it into a polished game. As expected, the wacky gadgets that make gameplay so fun return. There are new and inventive gadgets to entice newcomers and longtime fans just the same. A lot of the staple gadgets return as well. The recreation of Ratchet and Clank has been done justice and gives gamers hope that future reboots of their other favorite series will happen at some point too. Insomniac has taken 14 years of a series and compacted the best parts of each game into a new release and it is a masterpiece.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/K92we8B.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=#FFFFFF][b][url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/3056178/storage/intel-claims-storage-supremacy-with-swift-3d-xpoint-optane-drives-1-petabyte-3d-nand.html]Intel Introduces “Optane” Drives, Destroying Traditional SSD Speeds [/url][/b][/color]
At their annual developer forum in China, Intel have announced a new type of solid-state memory based on a memory they call 3D XPoint.  With the announcement came a demonstration with some crazy results. In their tests they transferred a large 25GB video file to a traditional SSD and to an Optane SSD.  Although both were fast, the Optane SSD flew through it at speeds of 2Gbps, finishing the transfer in 15 seconds, while the traditional SSD sat at about 300Mbps, finishing the transfer in about three times the time it took the Optane. Along with the unveiling of the Optane, Intel also talked about their other project based on 3D NAND memory instead of XPoint, which is a ridiculous 1-Petabyte drive. As crazy as it sounds, this will mostly be used for business applications such as rackmount servers. 
[color=#FFFFFF][b]
[url=https://www.techdirt.com/articles/20160410/06272034141/as-isps-push-harder-usage-caps-house-pushes-bill-preventing-fcc-doing-anything-about-it.shtml]While ISPs Continue to Rollout Data Caps, House Passes Bill to Prevent Stopping it[/url][/b][/color]
With ISPs gouging prices in uncompetitive markets, the House has passed a bill that goes by H.R. 2666 which limits much of the power the FCC has to protect consumers. The biggest issue with this bill is if it takes effect, ISPs such as Comcast, AT&T and others will be able to keep adding data caps and on top of that increase prices for their internet services at a moment’s notice. Although the bill has unfortunately passed at 241 to 173 votes, president Obama has publicly stated that he will veto the bill if it reaches his desk.
[color=#FFFFFF][b]
[url=http://www.digitaltrends.com/cool-tech/aum-affordable-prosthetic-voice-box-india/]Doctor Creates Inexpensive Device to Help Throat Cancer Patients Speak Again[/url][/b][/color]
For those with throat cancer, in many cases the cancer means having to have your voice box removed, and instead having very expensive devices being implanted to be able to speak. An Indian doctor named Dr. Vishal Rao has come up with a solution for this, and it costs less than a single dollar.  Rao calls the device AUM, and what makes it so special is the device costs about 75 cents to produce, and unlike the expensive surgical implants, it only takes 15 minutes to install. AUM works by redirecting air the comes from the lungs, right into the patient’s esophagus so sounds can be created using this path. The sounds won’t sound like what they had before surgery, but nevertheless the device is a cheap means for those who don’t have the ability to pay for expensive treatments to speak again.[/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/280/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.ehackingnews.com/2016/04/personal-data-of-50-million-turkish.html][b][color=white]Turkish President's Data Leaked Along With Millions of Other Citizens[/color][/b][/url]
A massive database leak containing 50 million people has been leaked online. The leak claims to have included the details of the Turkish President, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, along with his predecessors. On April 4, the data (49,611,709 to be precise) was disclosed on a website. The data can be downloaded via Torrent and Magnet URL. The data contains a person's full name, national identifier number, gender, address as well as much more worrying details. The hackers left the rhetorical question "Who would have imagined that backwards ideologies, cronyism and rising religious extremism in Turkey would lead to a crumbling and vulnerable technical infrastructure?" The hackers responsible for the database leak also though they would educate the Turkish authorities by giving them security tips and stating that voting for Trump is a very bad idea. The hacktivist is still yet to be named.

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/04/farook-fbi-iphone-unlock.html][b][color=white]Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) Finds Nothing![/color][/b][/url]
The FBI previously found a way to access the San Bernardino terrorist's iPhone with the help of a Israeli mobile forensic firm. The Department of Justice and the FBI has now reported there was "absolutely nothing useful on it." The FBI had high hopes of finding something useful on the iPhone, as this was one of three phones the terrorist owned. The other two phones were found in an irreparable condition at the terrorist's home. In light of the FBI's announcement, Apple is now working on encrypting iCloud backups to make it even harder for a person's privacy to be invaded with the help of Frederic Jacobs from the messaging app, Signal. Big companies like Whatsapp are taking precautions to prevent the invasion of a user's privacy.

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/04/blackberry-encryption.html][b][color=white]BlackBerry Messenger Has Never Been Really Entirely Secure[/color][/b][/url]
The first mobile provider to allow its customers to have end-to-end encryption, provided law enforcement a master key back in 2010 to decrypt any message sent over BlackBerry Messenger (BBM). Canadian Police claim to have a global decryption key which has now been used to decrypt over a million messages. Whether BlackBerry handed it over by choice or by force is still unclear. After this rumour aired, BlackBerry apparently changed their global decryption key, however, it is still believed that the Canadian Police still have the ability to decrypt a person's BBM messages. 

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/R8BL7M8.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://money.cnn.com/2016/04/15/technology/apple-gold-recycling/][b][color=white]Apple Makes Millions off old iPhones[/color][/b][/url]
Apple has figured out a way to make even more money off their phones. In their recent annual environmental report, the company stated it has recovered 2,204 pounds of gold from recycled iPhones. At the time of writing, the price of gold is $1234.60 per troy ounce. Surprisingly, this means that Apple made over $40 million dollars from their recycling efforts. During the company's most recent recycling program, which covers much more than gold, the company said it will be able to reuse 61 million out of 90 million pounds of waste.

[url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/04/saudi-arabia-strips-religious-police-arresting-power-160413141418824.html][b][color=white]Religious Police Stripped of Power in Saudi Arabia[/color][/b][/url]
A shift of power has taken place in the highly religious country of Saudi Arabia. Religious police, previously used to arrest those who were caught violating Islamic rules (such as drinking or doing drugs), were relinquished of their arresting power. Under the new laws, the Mutawaa, or religious police, must "carry out the duties of encouraging virtue and forbidding vice by advising kindly and gently." If the religious police have concern, they may no longer detain individuals, and must now report violators to the authorities. This move by the Saudi government is expected to decrease some controversy within the country.

[url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-04-12/victoria-becomes-first-state-to-legalise-medicinal-cannabis/7321152][b][color=white]Australia to Begin Permitting Medicinal Usage of Marijuana[/color][/b][/url]
With the recent passage of a health bill through parliament, the Australian state of Victoria has become the first in the nation to permit medical marijuana usage. Under this new legalization, children suffering from Epilepsy will be the first to have access to the drug. The change in restrictions was driven by observations revealing Marijuana's improvement to the quality of life for those suffering from medical complications. The drug will be available in a variety of forms including vaporisable liquids, capsules, oils, and sprays. The state's medical marijuana is expected to be accessible in 2017.
